image.altText: Man in blue coat walking behind man in tan coat and scarf with stone building behind them.

props.synopsis: After telling police officers in his home that "relationships will obviously have their moments where there's tension", a Tasmanian supreme court judge found himself charged with assault and emotional abuse or intimidation.

title.children: How a judge became the judged, from the moment police knocked on his front door

image.altText: A sign in a window which says Networ Outage hope to open soon

props.synopsis: CrowdStrike became a household name on Friday for all the wrong reasons. Here's what we know about them.

title.children: How a group of tech 'rebels' triggered the world's biggest IT meltdown

image.altText: Shop front with the sign 'Cignall' in black writing above the door

props.synopsis: Australia's tobacco excise is "well past its point of effectiveness", according to one expert, who says it's pushing smokers onto the black market, hurting retailers and taxpayers.

title.children: 'Excessively high' cigarette taxes fuelling black market as retailers fear expansion of tobacco wars

image.altText: A woman can be seen through an open doorway from a hallway. Her face can't be seen.

props.synopsis: At stake in the upcoming US election is something Americans once took for granted — and Donald Trump helped take away.

title.children: This issue has divided America for decades. Could it stop Trump from becoming president again?

image.altText: A young woman wearing blue flag over her shoulders and red white and blue face paint with star sunglasses

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is holding his first rally since the assassination attempt at his campaign event last weekend, with his newly minted running mate JD Vance joining him in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Follow live.

title.children: Security tight as Trump prepares for first campaign stop since assassination attempt

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Joe Biden delivers': Harris dismisses concerns about president's age
An update from Joe Biden's doctor
JD Vance is already here pumping up the crowd

image.altText: A red football sits on the grass next to Hobart Cenotaph.

props.synopsis: The head of Tasmania's RSL says his organisation has been "disrespected and misled at every turn" by the government and the architectural firm behind the planned Hobart stadium — warning a structure of its size will "desecrate" the "sacred" location of the nearby cenotaph.

title.children: RSL says it has been 'deceived and misled' about Macquarie Point stadium proposal by Tasmanian government

image.altText: A man in a suit standing in front of a purple screen

props.synopsis: Green hydrogen might be more efficient than petrol but it doesn't rate against a battery-driven vehicle, and funding it is proving to be difficult with iron ore prices falling.

title.children: Why Andrew Forrest stepped back on green hydrogen

image.altText: White tea cups sit near two silver flasks on a small coffee table in a luxury hotel room.

props.synopsis: Investors meet at a luxury hotel in Bangkok to try to get their money back, but none leave alive and now Thai police and the FBI are investigating an apparent murder-suicide by cyanide poisoning.

title.children: The luxury Bangkok hotel, the disastrous investment scheme, and the murderous cyanide plot

image.altText: A dark-haired woman wearing floral statement earrings and black blazer walks up the entrance ramp of a metallic building.

props.synopsis: A former Miss Australia and ex-Tasmanian MP has denied allegations of punching and slapping her former husband, telling him to kill himself, and preventing him from seeing his parents in day four of alleged assault case.

title.children: Former Tasmanian MP denies telling husband to 'kill himself', court hears

image.altText: A handwritten sign on a shop window that says: system down, sorry!!! in black marker

props.synopsis: One configuration file that updates multiple times a day was the cause behind a system crash that spread worldwide.

title.children: Channel File 291: The tiny update that caused a global IT outage

image.altText: Prince George of Wales and Prince William hug each other in the box of a soccer stadium

props.synopsis: During the UEFA Euro final the whole world saw the warmth of Prince William and Prince George's relationship. In a family fractured with discord and burdened with ill-health, this was a tonic.

title.children: In a fractured royal family, Prince William and George's show of joy at the Euro final was a tonic

image.altText: SAS soldier overlooks valley in Afghanistan as Black Hawk helicopter flies past in 2012.

props.synopsis: The Australian government has laid out how it will compensate the families of people found to have been unlawfully killed or abused by Australian special forces in Afghanistan.

title.children: Defence takes 'significant step forward' to compensate for unlawful Afghanistan killings

image.altText: An older Indian man with a Hindi decoration on his forehead, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Indian prime minister won the election but lost his majority — even losing ground in his own seat. Has the spell broken?

title.children: Modi said he was 'sent by God'. It didn't win him the election

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Don’t be shy now. You think you know it all? Prove it. Let’s play … HARD!

image.altText: Heather Donahue in The Blair Witch Project

props.synopsis: The creative low-budget film gave rise to a new genre of found-footage nightmares — and the tradition continues today.

title.children: The Blair Witch Project changed the horror genre as we knew it and 25 years later, it's still inspiring generations of storytellers

image.altText: Clare O'Neil

props.synopsis: Australians are warned to stay vigilant as scammers and hackers try to capitalise on Friday's global tech crash.

title.children: Scammers will pounce on global tech outage, home affairs minister warns

image.altText: A Japanese man stands in a boat with two other men while holding up a fan.

props.synopsis: From historical dramas to goofy vampire comedies here are the recently Emmy-nominated shows that deserve a weekend binge watch.

title.children: From Steve Martin to samurais: These are the TV shows to get across ahead of the Emmys

image.altText: A vapour trail in a sunset sky over the ocean, and silhouettes of palm trees.

props.synopsis: Five years after Starlink satellites started orbiting the Earth, Pacific Island countries are still weighing up its benefits despite calls to approve its services.

title.children: Elon Musk's Starlink satellites promise to connect the Pacific to the internet. So why are some countries trying to ban it?

image.altText: Thick snow covering Thredbo village

props.synopsis: A cold front moving across south-eastern states is dumping snow, with strong, damaging winds bringing down trees and power lines.

title.children: Hazardous weather across Australia's south-east dumps snow, brings damaging winds

image.altText: Stacey and Nathaniel Train on their wedding day, with Nathaniel's brother Gareth.

props.synopsis: Background Briefing can reveal that Australia's first alleged Christian terrorists forged their fateful bond years ago following an explosive family rift.

title.children: 'Bewildered': Trio made shocking allegations against parents years before deadly ambush

image.altText: Collingwood walks off the MCG after its AFL loss to Hawthorn.

props.synopsis: Four straight losses leaves Collingwood's premiership defence hanging by a thread, but Magpies coach Craig McRae vows to keep fighting after a harrowing defeat to Hawthorn.

title.children: 'We're still breathing': Why the Magpies aren't giving up on their premiership defence

image.altText: A man grabs at an ankle injury after a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Storm showed why they're six points clear at the top of the NRL ladder in a comprehensive win over the Roosters with winger Grant Anderson having the game of a lifetime until a last-minute injury.

title.children: Melbourne flex premiership muscles as unheralded Storm flyer has the night of his life - until the final second of the match

image.altText: A Windows PC shwing a "Blue Screen of Death" error.

props.synopsis: Friday afternoon felt frighteningly similar to the 12-minute mark in a disaster movie. The difference is that in the movie, a villain is pulling the strings, but in reality, the culprit was far closer to home.

title.children: The global tech crash opened like a Hollywood disaster film. So, how does it end?

image.altText: Chinese officials sitting in front of communist symbol in a conference.

props.synopsis: The conclusion of the Chinese Communist Party's 20th Third Plenum marks a significant moment in Chinese politics, as Xi Jinping appears to be laying the groundwork for an unprecedented fourth term.

title.children: Xi Jinping prepares for a fourth term, sets the course for China's economy for the next decade

image.altText: People move around below a blank sign in a Berlin airport

props.synopsis: Seemingly all at once, millions of computers around the world became unusable and unable to be rebooted, showing what's known in the industry as the "Blue Screen of Death".

title.children: How a bug in a little-known piece of software caused a global meltdown

image.altText: An altered mugshot shows the mysterious Hamas military commander Mohammed Deif, who is known as The Guest.

props.synopsis: A leading Hamas military commander in Gaza has survived multiple Israeli attempts to kill him, but after a recent massive strike on what Israeli military said was a militant compound, they may have finally gotten their man — now all they need is evidence.

title.children: Israel has tried to assassinate 'The Guest' seven times. Here's how his luck may have finally run out

image.altText: A woman stands on the side of a dirt road near buildings and flashing a V-sign with her fingers at a military vehicle driving by

props.synopsis: The world's highest court issues an opinion that describes Israel's actions as a breach of the Geneva Convention and other international law.

title.children: Top UN court says Israeli occupation of Palestinian territories is illegal

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a bandage on his ear, pumps his fist and walks off stage

props.synopsis: Seven days ago, a defiant Joe Biden was refusing calls to withdraw from this year's election while Donald Trump prepared for a huge rally ahead of the Republican National Convention. And then everything changed.

title.children: This week will go down as a chaotic chapter in US political history. What just happened?

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: Joe Biden is insistent on staying in the presidential race, despite a growing thrum of concern among senior Democrats who say he may not be able to defeat Donald Trump in the 2024 election.

title.children: Biden campaign insists he will stay in presidential race, amid growing calls to stand down

image.altText: Protesters on the street.

props.synopsis: Bangladesh announces a nationwide curfew and the deployment of military forces after police failed to quell days of deadly unrest spreading throughout the country.

title.children: Bangladesh imposes curfew, calls in military as 110 die in student-led protests

image.altText: A person wearing bright orange looks at a bridge which has partially collapsed.

props.synopsis: The bridge collapsed after heavy storms and flooding in China's northern Shaanxi province.

title.children: At least 11 killed and dozens missing after China bridge collapses amid floods

image.altText: A man with a widow's peak lines up a shot on a pool table.

props.synopsis: The six-time world snooker champion's death followed a battle with cancer, his wife says.

title.children: Ray Reardon, the six-time world snooker champion known as 'Dracula', dies aged 91

image.altText: A man wearing a cap makes a coffee in a coffee shop.

props.synopsis: As industry experts continue to grapple with how a suspected defect in a computer update brought the world to a halt, Australians recount how the incident unfolded.

title.children: 'At least the coffee shop's open': Australians' 'frustrating' Friday amid IT outage

image.altText: A woman wearing a traditional Indian outfit drinking a glass of champagne

props.synopsis: How do you sum up the experiences of Australia's second-largest migrant population in one book? Growing Up Indian In Australia editor Aarti Betigeri speaks on the dangers of assuming all Indians had the same upbringing.

title.children: How do you sum up the experiences of Australia's second-largest population group in one book?
